com.lasarobotics.library.util

Class Timers

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.lasarobotics.library.util.Timers

  • public class Timers
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements advanced timers with events and precision manipulation.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Timers()
      Instantiates the timer class with the default millisecond precision.
      Timers(int precision)
      Instantiates the timer class with an arbitrary precision in milliseconds.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      long getClockValue(java.lang.String name)
      Get clock value.

      Get clock value with precision in a given time unit
      long getPrecision()
      Gets the precision in milliseconds
      boolean isAtTargetMillis(java.lang.String name, long target)
      Returns whether the clock is at the specified amount of milliseconds
      boolean isAtTargetMillis(java.lang.String name, long target, long precision)
      Returns whether the clock is at the specified amount of milliseconds
      void resetClock(java.lang.String name)
      Reset a clock with the specified name.
      void setPrecision(int precision)
      Sets the precision to a value
      void startClock(java.lang.String name)
      Start (and create, if nonexistent) a clock with a specified name.

    • Method Detail

      • startClock

        public void startClock(java.lang.String name)
        Start (and create, if nonexistent) a clock with a specified name.
        Parameters:
        name - The clock name

      • resetClock

        public void resetClock(java.lang.String name)
        Reset a clock with the specified name. Clock will continue running immediately.
        Parameters:
        name - The clock name

      • getClockValue

        public long getClockValue(java.lang.String name)
        Get clock value. Defaults to millisecond precision.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the clock
        Returns:
        Value of clock in milliseconds

      • getClockValue

        public long getClockValue(java.lang.String name,
                 java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Get clock value with precision in a given time unit
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the clock
        timeUnit - TimeUnit the output should be in
        Returns:
        The value of the clock converted to the time unit specified (may lose precision)

      • isAtTargetMillis

        public boolean isAtTargetMillis(java.lang.String name,
                       long target)
        Returns whether the clock is at the specified amount of milliseconds
        Parameters:
        name - The clock name
        target - The target time in milliseconds
        Returns:
        True if at the target (+- precision), false otherwise

      • isAtTargetMillis

        public boolean isAtTargetMillis(java.lang.String name,
                       long target,
                       long precision)
        Returns whether the clock is at the specified amount of milliseconds
        Parameters:
        name - The clock name
        target - The target time in milliseconds
        precision - How much target and clock value can differ by in milliseconds
        Returns:
        True if at the target (+- precision), false otherwise

      • getPrecision

        public long getPrecision()
        Gets the precision in milliseconds
        Returns:
        Precision in milliseconds

      • setPrecision

        public void setPrecision(int precision)
        Sets the precision to a value
        Parameters:
        precision - The precision of the clock, in milliseconds.
